Class SparseSampledContinuousFunction<UD extends javax.measure.Quantity<UD>,UR extends javax.measure.Quantity<UR>>

    public class SparseSampledContinuousFunction<UD extends javax.measure.Quantity<UD>,UR extends javax.measure.Quantity<UR>>
extends LockingSampledContinuousFunction<UD,UR>
    A (currently) immutable implementation of RegularSampledDomain which optimizes memory usage for sampled continua with mostly 0 sample values in the codomain.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SparseSampledContinuousFunction

        public SparseSampledContinuousFunction(SampledDomain<UD> domain,
                                       javax.measure.Unit<UR> unitRange,
                                       int samples,
                                       int[] indices,
                                       double[] intensities)
        Instantiate based on the given significant sample indices and intensities. Samples at indices other than those given are assumed to be of intensity 0 in the codomain.
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain of the function
        unitRange - the units of measurement of values in the range
        samples - The number of non-zero samples
        indices - The sequential indices of non-zero samples
        intensities - The intensities at the given non-zero sample indices

        Create a memory efficient view of the given array, with the given frequency.
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain of the function
        unitRange - the units of measurement of values in the range
        intensities - The intensities as a sequence of samples at the given frequency

      • copy

      • resample

        public SampledContinuousFunction<UD,UR> resample(SampledDomain<UD> resolvableSampleDomain)
        Description copied from interface: ContinuousFunction
        Sometimes it is useful to linearize a continuous function in order to perform complex processing, or for display purposes. This method provides a linear view of any continuous function. Implementations may remove features which are unresolvable at the given resolution.

        Note that the parameter only represents the resolvable domain and the contained samples may not be exactly represented in the domain of the output. For example an implementation may retain some sub-resolution features to indicate maxima and minima within a resolvable interval, such that thin peaks and troughs don't disappear from visual representation at low resolution.

        Specified by:
        resample in interface ContinuousFunction<UD extends javax.measure.Quantity<UD>,UR extends javax.measure.Quantity<UR>>
        Specified by:
        resample in interface SampledContinuousFunction<UD extends javax.measure.Quantity<UD>,UR extends javax.measure.Quantity<UR>>
        Overrides:
        resample in class LockingSampledContinuousFunction<UD extends javax.measure.Quantity<UD>,UR extends javax.measure.Quantity<UR>>
        Parameters:
        resolvableSampleDomain - a representation of the resolvable sample domain
        Returns:
        a new sampled, linear continuous function roughly equal to the receiver to the requested resolution
